page.title: 14A1 ROUNDABOUT WETHERBY
page.content: Due to the high volume of traffic using the Wetherby roundabout (the junction of the A58 and A1), it has become a notorious accident blackspot. A proposal has been made to re-route the A1 at this point, as part of the { {Kirkhamgate-Dishforth Scheme}(to link the M1 south of Leeds to the A1 near Wetherby). The new route, avoiding the roundabout, will follow the existing A1 until \ a mile south of the roundabout where it will curve eastwards through Grange Park, crossing the River Wharfe over a new bridge, passing west of the race- course to rejoin the A1 north of the York Road flyover. If approved the project should commence in the late 1980's. Several environmental pressure groups and local land-owners have opposed the scheme but it would appear to be the most realistic solution.
